geneVariantDescriptions.description: MLH1 P648S lies within the EXO1-interacting region of the Mlh1 protein (PMID: 22753075). P648S results in decreased Mlh1 protein expression in cell culture (PMID: 21120944, PMID: 16083711), and reduced Pms2 binding in an in vitro assay (PMID: 16724012), but demonstrates proficient mismatch repair activity in in vitro assays (PMID: 21120944, PMID: 16083711, PMID: 15139004), and therefore, its effect on Mih1 protein function is unknown.

references.title: Functional significance and clinical phenotype of nontruncating mismatch repair variants of MLH1.
Assessing the pathogenicity of MLH1 missense mutations in patients with suspected hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer: correlation with clinical, genetic and functional features.
HNPCC mutation MLH1 P648S makes the functional protein unstable, and homozygosity predisposes to mild neurofibromatosis type 1.
Functional characterization of MLH1 missense variants identified in Lynch syndrome patients.
Verification of the three-step model in assessing the pathogenicity of mismatch repair gene variants.
